result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Maurice Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Straight time.  Court approved electronic monitoring subject to HOC screening.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees by the end of probation or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Maurice Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for THREE (3) DAYS time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.  CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.
* Random urine screens.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees by the end of Probation OR CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the Defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  COURT VACATED THE STAYED WARRANT ISSUED AT THE PREVIOUS DATE.  Defense advised the Court that the Defendant was present at the scheduled date of 03-28-2016 and met with JusticePoint.  Defense advised that in no way Defendant meant to offend the Court with his non-appearance.  Defense advised that Defendant has a FIVE (5) YEAR old child and had to pick the child up from day care.  Defendant does not have an active phone at this time.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant has missed NUMEROUS office contacts since November, 2015.  Defendant has been testing negative but Defendant missed EIGHT (8) random tests.  Defense advised the Court that Defendant is at the mercy of the schedule of his Significant Other as she works FORTY (40) HOURS per week and has a rotating day off during the week.  Defense communicated the information about his Significant Other via email to Defendant's case manager.  Defendant stated that he had communicated the same information to his FIRST case manager.  Court ordered Defendant to be more communicative with his case manager.  Defense and Defendant will be reporting to JusticePoint DIRECTLY following this hearing.  State MAY move for Revocation at the next hearing if Defendant's attendance continues as is.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant WAS in Court but was not present in Court due to Child Care issues.  Court ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT HEARNG.  Review hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Due to the unavailability of the Court,  matter is RESCHEDULED to 03-28-2016 at 01:30 pm for final Review hearing.  sdg

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Defendant has yet to complete the 5 (FIVE) hours of Community Service.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Ashley, Branch 33 for a Review Hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Violation Report received and filed with the court.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Shelton did not check in with the court. Court ordered case adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel is seeking a DPA resolution and requests a projected guilty plea date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

CASE HEARD BY JUDGE GUOLEE
Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn for Danielle Shelton.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court admonished the Defendant for appearing very late to court. Court ordered Defendant to appear to ALL court appearances on time. Court ordered Defendant to JusticePoint.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD BEFORE JUDGE GUOLEE.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz appearing with Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Christina Schultz.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for status conference on July 22, 2015 in Branch 45.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: missed office visit on 7-01-2015.  Defendant has resumed contact with Justice Point.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 7-22-2015.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense counsel is seeking a DPA resolution and requests a status date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: positive drug test on 6-25-2015.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 7-01-2015.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Andre Maurice Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andre Maurice Smith
Current: 3319 N. 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 06-12-2015)
Prior: 223 West Keefe Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53212
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Andre Maurice Smith not in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-071  

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
